intro: Delaportea armata, commonly known as the golden star or the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, silvery-grey pubescence. Delaportea armata is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
